Intel Entry-Level Battlemage (Xe2) Released 2025-01-16

Intel Arc B570

The most affordable Battlemage GPU at $219 with 10GB VRAM. The Arc B570 targets the entry-level segment and delivers surprising performance for its price, making it a solid choice for budget-conscious gamers.

Pros & Cons

Pros

  • + Very affordable at $219
  • + 10GB VRAM — exceptional at this price
  • + Good 1080p gaming
  • + Low power consumption
  • + AV1 encode/decode

Cons

  • - Entry-level performance
  • - Driver concerns
  • - Limited ray tracing
  • - Narrow 160-bit bus

Who Is the Intel Arc B570 Best For?

Entry-level gaming Students on a budget HTPC builds Media PCs

Frequently Asked Questions

Is the Intel Arc B570 good for gaming?

The Intel Arc B570 scores 50/100 at 1080p, 40/100 at 1440p, and 20/100 at 4K in our gaming benchmarks. It is best suited for entry-level gaming and students on a budget.

What is the price of the Intel Arc B570?

The Intel Arc B570 has an MSRP of $219 and is currently available for approximately $219.

How much VRAM does the Intel Arc B570 have?

The Intel Arc B570 has 10GB of GDDR6 memory on a 160-bit memory bus, providing adequate memory for 1080p gaming and everyday use.

What power supply do I need for the Intel Arc B570?

The Intel Arc B570 has a TDP of 150W. We recommend a minimum 500W power supply. It uses a 1x 8-pin power connector.
